member.name: T:PickerSample.adPickerOptions
member.summary: Flags that determine the object picker options

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerOptions.DSOP_FLAG_MULTISELECT
member.summary: If this flag is set, the user can select multiple objects. If this flag is not set, the user can select only one object.

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerOptions.DSOP_FLAG_SKIP_TARGET_COMPUTER_DC_CHECK
member.summary: If this flag is set and the DSOP_SCOPE_TYPE_TARGET_COMPUTER flag is set in the DSOP_SCOPE_INIT_INFO array, the target computer is always included in the Look in drop-down list. If this flag is not set and the target computer is an uplevel or downlevel domain controller, the DSOP_SCOPE_TYPE_TARGET_COMPUTER flag is ignored and the target computer is not included in the Lookin in drop-down list.

member.name: T:PickerSample.adPickerUplevelFilter
member.summary: Filter flags to use for an uplevel scope, regardless of whether it is a mixed or native mode domain

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerUplevelFilter.DSOP_FILTER_INCLUDE_ADVANCED_VIEW
member.summary: Includes objects that have the showInAdvancedViewOnly attribute set to true

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerUplevelFilter.DSOP_FILTER_USERS
member.summary: Includes user objects

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerUplevelFilter.DSOP_FILTER_BUILTIN_GROUPS
member.summary: Includes group objects with a groupType value having the flag GROUP_TYPE_BUILTIN_LOCAL_GROUP

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerUplevelFilter.DSOP_FILTER_WELL_KNOWN_PRINCIPALS
member.summary: Includes the contents of the WellKnown Security Principals container

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerUplevelFilter.DSOP_FILTER_UNIVERSAL_GROUPS_DL
member.summary: Includes distribution list universal groups

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerUplevelFilter.DSOP_FILTER_UNIVERSAL_GROUPS_SE
member.summary: Includes security enabled universal groups

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerUplevelFilter.DSOP_FILTER_GLOBAL_GROUPS_DL
member.summary: Includes distribution list global groups

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerUplevelFilter.DSOP_FILTER_GLOBAL_GROUPS_SE
member.summary: Includes security enabled global groups

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerUplevelFilter.DSOP_FILTER_DOMAIN_LOCAL_GROUPS_DL
member.summary: Includes distribution list domain global groups

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerUplevelFilter.DSOP_FILTER_DOMAIN_LOCAL_GROUPS_SE
member.summary: Includes security enabled domain local groups

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerUplevelFilter.DSOP_FILTER_CONTACTS
member.summary: Includes contact objects

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerUplevelFilter.DSOP_FILTER_COMPUTERS
member.summary: Includes computer objects

member.name: T:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter
member.summary: Filter flags to use for downlevel scopes

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_USERS
member.summary: Includes user objects

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_LOCAL_GROUPS
member.summary: Includes all local groups

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_GLOBAL_GROUPS
member.summary: Includes all global groups

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_COMPUTERS
member.summary: Includes computer objects

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_WORLD
member.summary: Includes the well-known security principal World (Everyone), a group that includes all users

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_AUTHENTICATED_USER
member.summary: Includes the well-known security principal Authenticated User, a group that includes all authenticated accounts in the target domain and its trusted domains

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_ANONYMOUS
member.summary: Includes the well-known security principal Anonymous, which refers to null session logons

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_BATCH
member.summary: Includes the well-known security principal Batch, which refers to batch server logons

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_CREATOR_OWNER
member.summary: Includes the well-known security principal Creator Owner

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_CREATOR_GROUP
member.summary: Includes the well-known security principal Creator Group

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_DIALUP
member.summary: Includes the well-known security principal Dialup

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_INTERACTIVE
member.summary: Includes the well-known security principal Interactive, which refers to users who log on to interactively use the computer

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_NETWORK
member.summary: Includes the well-known security principal Network, which refers to network logons for high performance servers

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_SERVICE
member.summary: Includes the well-known security principal Service, which refers to Win32 service logons

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_SYSTEM
member.summary: Includes the well-known security principal System, which refers to the LocalSystem account

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_EXCLUDE_BUILTIN_GROUPS
member.summary: Excludes local built-in groups returned by groups' enumeration

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_TERMINAL_SERVER
member.summary: Includes the well-known security principal Terminal Server

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_ALL_WELLKNOWN_SIDS
member.summary: Includes all well-known security principals. This flag is the same as specifying all of the well-known security principal flags listed in this table. You should use this flag for forward compatibility because it causes your code to automatically include any other downlevel well-known SIDs that might be added in the future.

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_LOCAL_SERVICE
member.summary: Includes the well-known security principal Service, which refers to Win32 service logons

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_NETWORK_SERVICE
member.summary: Includes the well-known security principal Service, which refers to Win32 service logons

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerDownlevelFilter.DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_REMOTE_LOGON
member.summary: Includes the well-known security principal, which refers to users who log on to remote use the computer

member.name: T:PickerSample.adPickerScopeType
member.summary: A scope is an entry in the "Look In" dropdown list of the Object Picker dialog

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeType.DSOP_SCOPE_TYPE_TARGET_COMPUTER
member.summary: Computer specified by , NULL is local computer

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeType.DSOP_SCOPE_TYPE_UPLEVEL_JOINED_DOMAIN
member.summary: Uplevel domain to which target computer is joined

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeType.DSOP_SCOPE_TYPE_DOWNLEVEL_JOINED_DOMAIN
member.summary: Downlevel domain to which target computer is joined

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeType.DSOP_SCOPE_TYPE_ENTERPRISE_DOMAIN
member.summary: All domains in the enterprise to which the target computer belongs other than the JOINED_DOMAIN or USER_SPECIFIED_*_SCOPEs

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeType.DSOP_SCOPE_TYPE_GLOBAL_CATALOG
member.summary: The Entire Directory scope

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeType.DSOP_SCOPE_TYPE_EXTERNAL_UPLEVEL_DOMAIN
member.summary: All uplevel domains external to the enterprise but trusted by the domain to which the target computer is joined

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeType.DSOP_SCOPE_TYPE_EXTERNAL_DOWNLEVEL_DOMAIN
member.summary: All downlevel domains external to the enterprise but trusted by the domain to which the target computer is joined

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeType.DSOP_SCOPE_TYPE_WORKGROUP
member.summary: The workgroup of which is a member. Applies only if the is not joined to a domain

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeType.DSOP_SCOPE_TYPE_USER_ENTERED_UPLEVEL_SCOPE
member.summary: Any uplevel or downlevel scope generated by processing user input. If neither of these types is specified, user entries that do not refer to one of the scopes in the "Look In" control will be rejected

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeType.DSOP_SCOPE_TYPE_USER_ENTERED_DOWNLEVEL_SCOPE
member.summary: Any uplevel or downlevel scope generated by processing user input. If neither of these types is specified, user entries that do not refer to one of the scopes in the "Look In" control will be rejected

member.name: T:PickerSample.adPickerScopeFormat
member.summary: Flags that indicate the format used to return ADs paths for objects selected from this scope. The flScope member can also indicate the initial scope displayed in the Look in drop-down list.

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeFormat.DSOP_SCOPE_FLAG_STARTING_SCOPE
member.summary: The scope should be the first one selected in the Look In control after dialog initialization. If more than one scope specifies this flag, the one which is chosen to be the starting scope is implementation dependant.

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeFormat.DSOP_SCOPE_FLAG_WANT_PROVIDER_WINNT
member.summary: ADs paths for objects selected from this scope should be converted to use the WinNT provider

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeFormat.DSOP_SCOPE_FLAG_WANT_PROVIDER_LDAP
member.summary: ADs paths for objects selected from this scope should be converted to use the LDAP provider

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeFormat.DSOP_SCOPE_FLAG_WANT_PROVIDER_GC
member.summary: ADs paths for objects selected from this scope should be converted to use the GC provider

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeFormat.DSOP_SCOPE_FLAG_WANT_SID_PATH
member.summary: ADs paths for objects selected from this scope having an objectSid attribute should be converted to the form LDAP://<SID=x>, where x represents the hexidecimal digits of the objectSid attribute value

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerScopeFormat.DSOP_SCOPE_FLAG_WANT_DOWNLEVEL_BUILTIN_PATH
member.summary: ADs paths for downlevel well-known SID objects (for example, DSOP_DOWNLEVEL_FILTER_INTERACTIVE) are an empty string unless this flag is specified. If it is, the paths will be of the form WinNT://NT AUTHORITY/Interactive or WinNT://Creator owner.

member.name: T:PickerSample.adPickerReturnFormat
member.summary: What information about object the user selected to return

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerReturnFormat.Name
member.summary: The object's relative distinguished name (RDN)

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerReturnFormat.ADsPath
member.summary: The object's ADsPath. The format of this string depends on the flags specified in the for the scope from which this object was selected

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerReturnFormat.Class
member.summary: Object class attribute

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerReturnFormat.Object
member.summary: Active directory object itself

member.name: F:PickerSample.adPickerReturnFormat.UPN
member.summary: The object's userPrincipalName attribute value
